title: 'ShikshaNext': Rs 170-Cr EdTech, AI initiative launched for students
description: 'ShikshaNext', a Rs 170-Cr multi-donor initiative, has been launched to improve learning for underserved children using EdTech and AI. It aims to reach 13 million children by 2029 and is backed by Reliance Foundation and the Gates Foundation.

title: AI is the biggest platform shift of our lifetimes, says Pichai
description: NEW DELHI: Recounting a recent ride in a fully autonomous Waymo vehicle in San Francisco with his 83-year-old father, Google CEO Sundar Pichai said the real test of progress is when such systems can operate on India’s roads. “Back in my days in India, I couldn’t have imagined that one day I would spend time with teams building data centres in space... Seeing a Waymo ride past my dad’s house, I saw whole new progress. Of course, he said he’d be more impressed if it worked on India’s busy roads. Still working on that one, Dad,” he shared.

title: AI Impact Summit: Global Leaders Convene in Delhi for Major AI Push
description: Delhi's AI Impact Summit saw a massive convergence of global leaders, tech execs, and experts. David Sandalow of Columbia University praised the event's scale and India's clear determination to become a significant force in artificial intelligence.

title: AI for humanity: Guterres urges fact-based policy, global cooperation
description: UN Chief Antonio Guterres, speaking at the Global AI Impact Summit 2026, called for using AI for global good and urged for fact-based policy. He highlighted the UN's new AI Panel to guide international cooperation and ensure AI serves humanity.

title: World News | Global AI Impact Summit: UN Chief Calls for Global Unity, Says Science-led Governance an Accelerator for Solutions
description: Get latest articles and stories on World at LatestLY. UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres on Friday called for utilising Artificial Intelligence for global good and mitigate challenges being faced by humanity. He urged countries to come together and prepare, protect, and invest in people. Today international cooperation is difficult. Trust is strained, and technological rivalry is growing.
